greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Decimal expansion of 1/81.
comment: The decimal expansion of Sum_{n>=1} floor(n * tanh(Pi))/10^n is the same as that of 1/81 for the first 268 decimal places [Borwein et al.]
Sqrt(999999999999999999) = 9*sqrt(12345679012345679). - _Ryohei Miyadera_, Ken Hirotomi, Hiroyuki Ozaki and Atushi Tanaka, Jan 16 2006
reference: J. Borwein, D. Bailey and R. Girgensohn, Experimentation in Mathematics: Computational Paths to Discovery, Peters, Boston, 2004. See Sect. 1.4.
link: Jean-François Alcover, 300 digits of Sum_{n>=1} floor(n*tanh(Pi))/10^n
mathematica: PadLeft[First@ #, Abs@ Last@ # + Length@ First@ #] &@ RealDigits[N[1/81, 120]] (* _Michael De Vlieger_, Jun 21 2016 *)
results.author: _N. J. A. Sloane_
